ROM_CLKGATE_FORCE_ON.description: Set the bit to 1 to force rom always have clock, for low power can clear to 0 then only when have access the rom have clock

SRAM_CLKGATE_FORCE_ON.description: Set the bit to 1 to force sram always have clock, for low power can clear to 0 then only when have access the sram have clock

ROM_POWER_DOWN.description: Set 1 to let rom power down

SRAM_POWER_DOWN.description: Set 1 to let sram power down

ROM_POWER_UP.description: Set 1 to let rom power up

SRAM_POWER_UP.description: Set 1 to let sram power up

SARADC_SAR_PATT_P_CLEAR.description: clear the pointer of pattern table for DIG ADC1 CTRL

SARADC_XPD_SAR_FORCE.description: force option to xpd sar blocks

SARADC_WAIT_ARB_CYCLE.description: wait arbit signal stable after sar_done

SARADC_SAR1_INV.description: 1: data to DIG ADC1 CTRL is inverted, otherwise not

SARADC_SAR2_INV.description: 1: data to DIG ADC2 CTRL is inverted, otherwise not

SARADC_SAR_PATT_TAB1.description: item 0 ~ 3 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SARADC_SAR_PATT_TAB2.description: Item 4 ~ 7 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

ADC_ARB_APB_FORCE.description: adc2 arbiter force to enableapb controller

ADC_ARB_RTC_FORCE.description: adc2 arbiter force to enable rtc controller

ADC_ARB_WIFI_FORCE.description: adc2 arbiter force to enable wifi controller

APB_ADC_EOF_NUM.description: the dma_in_suc_eof gen when sample cnt = spi_eof_num

REG_CLK_SEL.description: Set this bit to enable clk_apll

CORE_0_SP_SPILL_MIN_RAW.description: sp underlow monitor interrupt status register

CORE_0_SP_SPILL_MAX_RAW.description: sp overflow monitor interupt status register

CORE_0_SP_PC.description: This regsiter stores the PC when trigger stack monitor.

CORE_0_RCD_PDEBUGEN.description: Set 1 to enable cpu pdebug function, must set this bit can get cpu PC

CORE_0_DEBUG_MODE.description: cpu debug mode status, 1 means cpu enter debug mode.

IN_DONE.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one inlink descriptor has been received for Rx channel 0.

IN_SUC_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one inlink descriptor has been received for Rx channel 0. For UHCI0, the raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one inlink descriptor has been received and no data error is detected for Rx channel 0.

IN_ERR_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when data error is detected only in the case that the peripheral is UHCI0 for Rx channel 0. For other peripherals, this raw interrupt is reserved.

OUT_DONE.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one outlink descriptor has been transmitted to peripherals for Tx channel 0.

OUT_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one outlink descriptor has been read from memory for Tx channel 0.

IN_DSCR_ERR.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when detecting inlink descriptor error, including owner error, the second and third word error of inlink descriptor for Rx channel 0.

OUT_DSCR_ERR.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when detecting outlink descriptor error, including owner error, the second and third word error of outlink descriptor for Tx channel 0.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when Rx buffer pointed by inlink is full and receiving data is not completed, but there is no more inlink for Rx channel 0.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when data corresponding a outlink (includes one link descriptor or few link descriptors) is transmitted out for Tx channel 0.

INFIFO_OVF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Rx channel 0 is overflow.

INFIFO_UDF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Rx channel 0 is underflow.

OUTFIFO_OVF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Tx channel 0 is overflow.

OUTFIFO_UDF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Tx channel 0 is underflow.

IN_DONE.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the IN_DONE_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_SUC_EOF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the IN_SUC_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_ERR_EOF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the IN_ERR_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_DONE.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the OUT_DONE_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_EOF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the OUT_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_ERR.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the IN_DSCR_ERR_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_DSCR_ERR.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the OUT_DSCR_ERR_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the IN_DSCR_EMPTY_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the OUT_TOTAL_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

INFIFO_OVF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the INFIFO_OVF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

INFIFO_UDF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the INFIFO_UDF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

OUTFIFO_OVF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the OUTFIFO_OVF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

OUTFIFO_UDF.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the OUTFIFO_UDF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DONE.description: The interrupt enable bit for the IN_DONE_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_SUC_EOF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the IN_SUC_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_ERR_EOF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the IN_ERR_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_DONE.description: The interrupt enable bit for the OUT_DONE_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_EOF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the OUT_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_ERR.description: The interrupt enable bit for the IN_DSCR_ERR_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_DSCR_ERR.description: The interrupt enable bit for the OUT_DSCR_ERR_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY.description: The interrupt enable bit for the IN_DSCR_EMPTY_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the OUT_TOTAL_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

INFIFO_OVF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the INFIFO_OVF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

INFIFO_UDF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the INFIFO_UDF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

OUTFIFO_OVF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the OUTFIFO_OVF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

OUTFIFO_UDF.description: The interrupt enable bit for the OUTFIFO_UDF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DONE.description: Set this bit to clear the IN_DONE_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_SUC_EOF.description: Set this bit to clear the IN_SUC_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_ERR_EOF.description: Set this bit to clear the IN_ERR_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_DONE.description: Set this bit to clear the OUT_DONE_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_EOF.description: Set this bit to clear the OUT_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_ERR.description: Set this bit to clear the IN_DSCR_ERR_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_DSCR_ERR.description: Set this bit to clear the OUT_DSCR_ERR_CH_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY.description: Set this bit to clear the IN_DSCR_EMPTY_CH_INT interrupt.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF.description: Set this bit to clear the OUT_TOTAL_EOF_CH_INT interrupt.

INFIFO_OVF.description: Set this bit to clear the INFIFO_OVF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

INFIFO_UDF.description: Set this bit to clear the INFIFO_UDF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

OUTFIFO_OVF.description: Set this bit to clear the OUTFIFO_OVF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

OUTFIFO_UDF.description: Set this bit to clear the OUTFIFO_UDF_L1_CH_INT interrupt.

AHBM_RST_INTER.description: Set this bit, then clear this bit to reset the internal ahb FSM.

ARB_PRI_DIS.description: Set this bit to disable priority arbitration function.

IN_RST.description: This bit is used to reset DMA channel 0 Rx FSM and Rx FIFO pointer.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Rx channel 0 reading link descriptor when accessing internal SRAM.

IN_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Rx channel 0 receiving data when accessing internal SRAM.

MEM_TRANS_EN.description: Set this bit 1 to enable automatic transmitting data from memory to memory via DMA.

IN_CHECK_OWNER.description: Set this bit to enable checking the owner attribute of the link descriptor.

INFIFO_FULL.description: L1 Rx FIFO full signal for Rx channel 0.

INFIFO_EMPTY.description: L1 Rx FIFO empty signal for Rx channel 0.

INFIFO_CNT.description: The register stores the byte number of the data in L1 Rx FIFO for Rx channel 0.

INFIFO_RDATA.description: This register stores the data popping from DMA FIFO.

INFIFO_POP.description: Set this bit to pop data from DMA FIFO.

INLINK_ADDR.description: This register stores the 20 least significant bits of the first inlink descriptor's address.

INLINK_AUTO_RET.description: Set this bit to return to current inlink descriptor's address, when there are some errors in current receiving data.

INLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the inlink descriptors.

INLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the inlink descriptors.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to mount a new inlink descriptor.

INLINK_PARK.description: 1: the inlink descriptor's FSM is in idle state.  0: the inlink descriptor's FSM is working.

INLINK_DSCR_ADDR.description: This register stores the current inlink descriptor's address.

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the inlink descriptor when the EOF bit in this descriptor is 1.

IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the inlink descriptor when there are some errors in current receiving data. Only used when peripheral is UHCI0.

INLINK_DSCR.description: The address of the current inlink descriptor x.

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The address of the last inlink descriptor x-1.

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The address of the second-to-last inlink descriptor x-2.

RX_PRI.description: The priority of Rx channel 0. The larger of the value, the higher of the priority.

PERI_IN_SEL.description: This register is used to select peripheral for Rx channel 0. 0:SPI2. 1: reserved. 2: UHCI0. 3: I2S0. 4: reserved. 5: reserved. 6: AES. 7: SHA. 8: ADC_DAC.

OUT_RST.description: This bit is used to reset DMA channel 0 Tx FSM and Tx FIFO pointer.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: Set this bit to enable automatic outlink-writeback when all the data in tx buffer has been transmitted.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description: EOF flag generation mode when transmitting data. 1: EOF flag for Tx channel 0 is generated when data need to transmit has been popped from FIFO in DMA

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Tx channel 0 reading link descriptor when accessing internal SRAM.

OUT_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Tx channel 0 transmitting data when accessing internal SRAM.

OUT_CHECK_OWNER.description: Set this bit to enable checking the owner attribute of the link descriptor.

OUTFIFO_FULL.description: L1 Tx FIFO full signal for Tx channel 0.

OUTFIFO_EMPTY.description: L1 Tx FIFO empty signal for Tx channel 0.

OUTFIFO_CNT.description: The register stores the byte number of the data in L1 Tx FIFO for Tx channel 0.

OUTFIFO_WDATA.description: This register stores the data that need to be pushed into DMA FIFO.

OUTFIFO_PUSH.description: Set this bit to push data into DMA FIFO.

OUTLINK_ADDR.description: This register stores the 20 least significant bits of the first outlink descriptor's address.

OUTLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the outlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the outlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to restart a new outlink from the last address.

OUTLINK_PARK.description: 1: the outlink descriptor's FSM is in idle state.  0: the outlink descriptor's FSM is working.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ADDR.description: This register stores the current outlink descriptor's address.

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the outlink descriptor when the EOF bit in this descriptor is 1.

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the outlink descriptor before the last outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_DSCR.description: The address of the current outlink descriptor y.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The address of the last outlink descriptor y-1.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The address of the second-to-last inlink descriptor x-2.

TX_PRI.description: The priority of Tx channel 0. The larger of the value, the higher of the priority.

PERI_OUT_SEL.description: This register is used to select peripheral for Tx channel 0. 0:SPI2. 1: reserved. 2: UHCI0. 3: I2S0. 4: reserved. 5: reserved. 6: AES. 7: SHA. 8: ADC_DAC.

MULT_INT_RAW.description: I2S interrupt raw register, valid in level.

CALC_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for the i2s_tx_hung_int interrupt

CALC_DONE_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit  for the i2s_rx_done_int interrupt

CALC_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit  for the i2s_rx_done_int interrupt

CALC_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the i2s_rx_done_int interrupt

START.description: Set this bit to reset receiver

RESET.description: Set this bit to reset Rx AFIFO

KEY_LENGTH.description: Set this bit to start receiving data

SECURITY_MODE.description: Set this bit to enable slave receiver mode

PGM_DATA0.description: Register 0 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA1.description: Register 1 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA2.description: Register 2 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA3.description: Register 3 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA4.description: Register 4 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA5.description: Register 5 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA6.description: Register 6 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA7.description: Register 7 that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_CHECK_VALUE0.description: Register 0 that stores the RS code to be programmed.

PGM_CHECK_VALUE1.description: Register 1 that stores the RS code to be programmed.

PGM_CHECK_VALUE2.description: Register 2 that stores the RS code to be programmed.

RD_REPEAT_ERR.description: Programming error record register 0 of BLOCK0.

RD_RS_ERR.description: Programming error record register 0 of BLOCK1-10.

WR_TIM_CONF0.description: Configurarion register 0 of eFuse programming timing parameters.

WR_TIM_CONF1.description: Configurarion register 1 of eFuse programming timing parameters.

WR_TIM_CONF2.description: Configurarion register 2 of eFuse programming timing parameters.

PGM_DATA_0.description: The content of the 0th 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA_1.description: The content of the 1st 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA_2.description: The content of the 2nd 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA_3.description: The content of the 3rd 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA_4.description: The content of the 4th 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA_5.description: The content of the 5th 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA_6.description: The content of the 6th 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_DATA_7.description: The content of the 7th 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_RS_DATA_0.description: The content of the 0th 32-bit RS code to be programmed.

PGM_RS_DATA_1.description: The content of the 1st 32-bit RS code to be programmed.

PGM_RS_DATA_2.description: The content of the 2nd 32-bit RS code to be programmed.

RD_DIS.description: The bit be set to disable software read high/low 128-bit of BLK3.

WDT_DELAY_SEL.description: Selects RTC watchdog timeout threshold, in unit of slow clock cycle. 0: 40000. 1: 80000. 2: 160000. 3:320000.

DIS_PAD_JTAG.description: Set this bit to disable pad jtag.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_ICACHE.description: The bit be set to disable icache in download mode.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.description: The bit be set to disable manual encryption.

SPI_BOOT_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT_CNT.description: These bits be set to enable SPI boot encrypt/decrypt. Odd number of 1: enable. even number of 1: disable.

XTS_KEY_LENGTH_256.description: The bit be set means XTS_AES use the whole 256-bit efuse data in BLOCK3. Otherwise, XTS_AES use 128-bit eFuse data in BLOCK3.

UART_PRINT_CONTROL.description: Set this bit to disable usb printing.

FORCE_SEND_RESUME.description: Set this bit to force ROM code to send a resume command during SPI boot.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MODE.description: Set this bit to disable download mode (boot_mode[3:0] = 0, 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7).

DIS_DIRECT_BOOT.description: This bit set means disable direct_boot mode.

ENABLE_SECURITY_DOWNLOAD.description: Set this bit to enable secure UART download mode.

FLASH_TPUW.description: Configures flash waiting time after power-up, in unit of ms. If the value is less than 15, the waiting time is the configurable value.  Otherwise, the waiting time is twice the configurable value.

SECURE_BOOT_EN.description: The bit be set to enable secure boot.

SYSTEM_DATA0.description: Stores the bits [0:31] of system data.

SYSTEM_DATA1.description: Stores the bits [32:63] of system data.

SYSTEM_DATA2.description: Stores the bits [64:87] of system data.

LDO_VOL_BIAS_CONFIG_LOW.description: Store the bit [0:2] of ido configuration parameters.

LDO_VOL_BIAS_CONFIG_HIGH.description: Store the bit [3:29] of ido configuration parameters.

ADC_CALIBRATION_0.description: Store the bit [0:21] of ADC calibration data.

ADC_CALIBRATION_1.description: Store the bit [22:53] of ADC calibration data.

ADC_CALIBRATION_2.description: Store the bit [54:85] of ADC calibration data.

ADC_CALIBRATION_3.description: Store the bit [86:96] of ADC calibration data.

BLK2_RESERVED_DATA_0.description: Store the bit [0:20] of block2 reserved data.

BLK2_RESERVED_DATA_1.description: Store the bit [21:52] of block2 reserved data.

RD_DIS_ERR.description: If any bit in RD_DIS is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

WDT_DELAY_SEL_ERR.description: If any bit in WDT_DELAY_SEL is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

DIS_PAD_JTAG_ERR.description: If any bit in DIS_PAD_JTAG is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_ICACHE_ERR.description: If any bit in this filed is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT_ERR.description: If any bit in DIS_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

SPI_BOOT_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT_CNT_ERR.description: If any bit in SPI_BOOT_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT_CNT is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

XTS_KEY_LENGTH_256_ERR.description: If any bit in XTS_KEY_LENGTH_256 is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

UART_PRINT_CONTROL_ERR.description: If any bit in UART_PRINT_CONTROL is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

FORCE_SEND_RESUME_ERR.description: If any bit in FORCE_SEND_RESUME is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MODE_ERR.description: If any bit in this filed is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

DIS_DIRECT_BOOT_ERR.description: If any bit in this filed is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

ENABLE_SECURITY_DOWNLOAD_ERR.description: If any bit in this filed is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

FLASH_TPUW_ERR.description: If any bit in this filed is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

SECURE_BOOT_EN_ERR.description: If any bit in this filed is 1, then it indicates a programming error.

BLK1_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in block1.

BLK1_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of block1 is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

BLK2_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in block2.

BLK2_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of block2 is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

BLK3_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in block3.

BLK3_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the block3 data is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

EFUSE_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: Set this bit to force eFuse SRAM into power-saving mode.

MEM_CLK_FORCE_ON.description: Set this bit and force to activate clock signal of eFuse SRAM.

EFUSE_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: Set this bit to force eFuse SRAM into working mode.

EN.description: Set this bit and force to enable clock signal of eFuse memory.

OP_CODE.description: 0x5A5A: Operate programming command 0x5AA5: Operate read command.

STATE.description: Indicates the state of the eFuse state machine.

BLK0_VALID_BIT_CNT.description: Record the number of bit '1' in BLOCK0.

READ_CMD.description: Set this bit to send read command.

PGM_CMD.description: Set this bit to send programming command.

BLK_NUM.description: The serial number of the block to be programmed. Value 0-3 corresponds to block number 0-3, respectively.

READ_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear signal for pgm_done interrupt.

DAC_CLK_DIV.description: Controls the division factor of the rising clock of the programming voltage.

DAC_NUM.description: Controls the rising period of the programming voltage.

OE_CLR.description: Reduces the power supply of the programming voltage.

THR_A.description: Configures hold time for efuse read.

TRD.description: Configures pulse time for efuse read.

TSUR_A.description: Configures setup time for efuse read.

READ_INIT_NUM.description: Configures the initial read time of eFuse.

THP_A.description: Configures hold time for efuse program.

TPGM_INACTIVE.description: Configures pulse time for burning '0' bit.

TPGM.description: Configures pulse time for burning '1' bit.

TSUP_A.description: Configures setup time for efuse program.

PWR_ON_NUM.description: Configures the power up time for VDDQ.

PWR_OFF_NUM.description: Configures the power outage time for VDDQ.

ICACHE_ENABLE.description: The bit is used to activate the data cache. 0: disable, 1: enable

ICACHE_SHUT_IBUS.description: The bit is used to disable core0 ibus, 0: enable, 1: disable

ICACHE_SHUT_DBUS.description: The bit is used to disable core1 ibus, 0: enable, 1: disable

ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_ON.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of  icache tag memory. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: The bit is used to power  icache tag memory down, 0: follow rtc_lslp, 1: power down

ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: The bit is used to power  icache tag memory up, 0: follow rtc_lslp, 1: power up

ICACHE_INVALIDATE_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable invalidate operation. It will be cleared by hardware after invalidate operation done.

ICACHE_SYNC_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate invalidate operation is finished.

ICACHE_SYNC_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for clean operations. It should be combined with ICACHE_SYNC_SIZE_REG.

ICACHE_SYNC_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for sync operations. The bits are the counts of cache block. It should be combined with ICACHE_SYNC_ADDR_REG.

IBUS_TO_FLASH_START_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of ibus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to ibus access counter.

IBUS_TO_FLASH_END_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the end virtual address of ibus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to ibus access counter.

DBUS_TO_FLASH_START_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of dbus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to dbus access counter.

DBUS_TO_FLASH_END_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the end virtual address of dbus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to dbus access counter.

IBUS_ACS_CNT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear ibus counter.

DBUS_ACS_CNT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear dbus counter.

ICACHE_SYNC_OP_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by sync configurations fault.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_OP_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by preload configurations fault.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by ibus counter overflow.

DBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by dbus counter overflow.

ICACHE_SYNC_OP_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by sync configurations fault.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_OP_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by preload configurations fault.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by ibus counter overflow.

DBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by dbus counter overflow.

ICACHE_SYNC_OP_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by sync configurations fault.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_OP_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by preload configurations fault.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus access flash/spiram counter overflow.

IBUS_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus access flash/spiram miss counter overflow.

DBUS_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus access flash/spiram counter overflow.

DBUS_ACS_FLASH_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus access flash miss counter overflow.

CORE0_IBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding ibus is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_IBUS_WR_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by ibus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_REJECT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding dbus is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_DBUS_REJECT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_WR_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by dbus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding ibus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_IBUS_WR_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by ibus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_REJECT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding dbus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_DBUS_REJECT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_WR_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by dbus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_ACS_MSK_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access  icache while the core0_ibus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_IBUS_WR_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_REJECT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_ACS_MSK_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access icache while the core0_dbus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_DBUS_REJECT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_WR_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus trying to write icache

CORE0_DBUS_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of CPU access dbus when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able, 4: write-able.

CORE0_DBUS_WORLD.description: The bit is used to indicate the world of CPU access dbus when authentication fail. 0: WORLD0, 1: WORLD1

CORE0_DBUS_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address of CPU access dbus when authentication fail.

CORE0_IBUS_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of CPU access ibus when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able

CORE0_IBUS_WORLD.description: The bit is used to indicate the world of CPU access ibus when authentication fail. 0: WORLD0, 1: WORLD1

CORE0_IBUS_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address of CPU access  ibus when authentication fail.

CACHE_MMU_FAULT_CONTENT.description: The bits are used to indicate the content of mmu entry which cause mmu fault..

CACHE_MMU_FAULT_CODE.description: The right-most 3 bits are used to indicate the operations which cause mmu fault occurrence. 0: default, 1: cpu miss, 2: preload miss, 3: writeback, 4: cpu miss evict recovery address, 5: load miss evict recovery address, 6: external dma tx, 7: external dma rx. The most significant bit is used to indicate this operation occurs in which one icache.

CACHE_MMU_FAULT_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address which cause mmu fault..

CACHE_FLASH_WRAP_AROUND.description: The bit is used to enable wrap around mode when read data from flash.

CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_ON.description: The bit is used to enable clock gating to save power when access mmu memory, 0: enable, 1: disable

CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: The bit is used to power mmu memory down, 0: follow_rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power down

CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: The bit is used to power mmu memory down, 0: follow_rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power up

ICACHE_STATE.description: The bit is used to indicate whether  icache main fsm is in idle state or not. 1: in idle state,  0: not in idle state

CLK_FORCE_ON_MANUAL_CRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of manual crypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

CLK_FORCE_ON_AUTO_CRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of automatic crypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

CLK_FORCE_ON_CRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of external memory encrypt and decrypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by  icache pre-load done.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by  icache pre-load done.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by  icache pre-load done.

ICACHE_SYNC_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by  icache sync done.

ICACHE_SYNC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by  icache sync done.

ICACHE_SYNC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by  icache sync done.

CACHE_MMU_OWNER.description: The bits are used to specify the owner of MMU.bit0/bit2: ibus, bit1/bit3: dbus

CACHE_IGNORE_PRELOAD_MMU_ENTRY_FAULT.description: The bit is used to disable checking mmu entry fault by preload operation.

CACHE_IGNORE_SYNC_MMU_ENTRY_FAULT.description: The bit is used to disable checking mmu entry fault by sync operation.

CACHE_TRACE_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable cache trace function.

CACHE_MMU_PAGE_SIZE.description: This bit is used to choose mmu page size. 2:64KB. 1. 32KB. 0: 16KB

ENA.description: The bit is used to enable icache freeze mode

MODE.description: The bit is used to configure freeze mode, 0:  assert busy if CPU miss 1: assert hit if CPU miss

DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate icache freeze success

ICACHE_ATOMIC_OPERATE_ENA.description: The bit is used to activate icache atomic operation protection. In this case, sync/lock operation can not interrupt miss-work. This feature does not work during invalidateAll operation.

BYPASS.description: The bit is used to disable request recording which could cause performance issue

PCPU_NMI_INT.description: GPIO PRO_CPU(not shielded) interrupt status register

OUT_W1TS.description: GPIO output set register for GPIO0-24

OUT_W1TC.description: GPIO output clear register for GPIO0-24

DATA.description: GPIO output enable register for GPIO0-24

ENABLE_W1TS.description: GPIO output enable set register for GPIO0-24

ENABLE_W1TC.description: GPIO output enable clear register for GPIO0-24

INTERRUPT.description: GPIO interrupt status register for GPIO0-24

STATUS_W1TS.description: GPIO interrupt status set register for GPIO0-24

STATUS_W1TC.description: GPIO interrupt status clear register for GPIO0-24

PROCPU_INT.description: GPIO PRO_CPU interrupt status register for GPIO0-24

PROCPU_NMI_INT.description: GPIO PRO_CPU(not shielded) interrupt status register for GPIO0-24

SDIO_INT.description: GPIO CPUSDIO interrupt status register for GPIO0-24

SYNC2_BYPASS.description: set GPIO input_sync2 signal mode. 0:disable. 1:trigger at negedge. 2or3:trigger at posedge.

PAD_DRIVER.description: set this bit to select pad driver. 1:open-drain. 0:normal.

SYNC1_BYPASS.description: set GPIO input_sync1 signal mode. 0:disable. 1:trigger at negedge. 2or3:trigger at posedge.

INT_TYPE.description: set this value to choose interrupt mode. 0:disable GPIO interrupt. 1:trigger at posedge. 2:trigger at negedge. 3:trigger at any edge. 4:valid at low level. 5:valid at high level

WAKEUP_ENABLE.description: set this bit to enable GPIO wakeup.(can only wakeup CPU from Light-sleep Mode)

INT_ENA.description: set bit 13 to enable CPU interrupt. set bit 14 to enable CPU(not shielded) interrupt.

STATUS_INTERRUPT_NEXT.description: GPIO interrupt source register for GPIO0-24

IN_SEL.description: set this value: s=0-53: connect GPIO[s] to this port. s=0x38: set this port always high level. s=0x3C: set this port always low level.

IN_INV_SEL.description: set this bit to invert input signal. 1:invert. 0:not invert.

SEL.description: set this bit to bypass GPIO. 1:do not bypass GPIO. 0:bypass GPIO.

OUT_SEL.description: The value of the bits: 0<=s<=256. Set the value to select output signal. s=0-255: output of GPIO[n] equals input of peripheral[s]. s=256: output of GPIO[n] equals GPIO_OUT_REG[n].

INV_SEL.description: set this bit to invert output signal.1:invert.0:not invert.

OEN_SEL.description: set this bit to select output enable signal.1:use GPIO_ENABLE_REG[n] as output enable signal.0:use peripheral output enable signal.

OEN_INV_SEL.description: set this bit to invert output enable signal.1:invert.0:not invert.

CLK_EN.description: set this bit to enable GPIO clock gate

SCL_LOW_PERIOD.description:
Configures the low level width of the SCL
Clock

TO.description: Setting time out control for receiving data.

INT_STATUS.description: Status of captured I2C communication events

SDA_HOLD.description: Configures the hold time after a negative SCL edge.

SDA_SAMPLE.description: Configures the sample time after a positive SCL edge.

SCL_HIGH_PERIOD.description: Configures the high level width of SCL

SCL_START_HOLD.description: Configures the delay between the SDA and SCL negative edge for a start condition

SCL_RSTART_SETUP.description:
Configures the delay between the positive
edge of SCL and the negative edge of SDA

SCL_STOP_HOLD.description:
Configures the delay after the SCL clock
edge for a stop condition

SCL_STOP_SETUP.description:
Configures the delay between the SDA and
SCL positive edge for a stop condition

FILTER_CFG.description: SCL and SDA filter configuration register

SCL_MAIN_ST_TIME_OUT.description: SCL main status time out register

SCL_LOW_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure for how long SCL remains low in master mode, in I2C module clock cycles.

SAMPLE_SCL_LEVEL.description:
This register is used to select the sample mode.
1: sample SDA data on the SCL low level.
0: sample SDA data on the SCL high level.

RX_FULL_ACK_LEVEL.description: This register is used to configure the ACK value that need to sent by master when the rx_fifo_cnt has reached the threshold.

MS_MODE.description:
Set this bit to configure the module as an I2C Master. Clear this bit to configure the
module as an I2C Slave.

TRANS_START.description: Set this bit to start sending the data in txfifo.

TX_LSB_FIRST.description:
This bit is used to control the sending mode for data needing to be sent. 
1: send data from the least significant bit,
0: send data from the most significant bit.

RX_LSB_FIRST.description:
This bit is used to control the storage mode for received data.
1: receive data from the least significant bit,
0: receive data from the most significant bit.

ARBITRATION_EN.description: This is the enable bit for arbitration_lost.

FSM_RST.description: This register is used to reset the scl FMS.

SLV_TX_AUTO_START_EN.description: This is the enable bit for slave to send data automatically

RESP_REC.description: The received ACK value in master mode or slave mode. 0: ACK, 1: NACK.

ARB_LOST.description: When the I2C controller loses control of SCL line, this register changes to 1.

BUS_BUSY.description: 1: the I2C bus is busy transferring data, 0: the I2C bus is in idle state.

RXFIFO_CNT.description: This field represents the amount of data needed to be sent.

TXFIFO_CNT.description: This field stores the amount of received data in RAM.

SCL_MAIN_STATE_LAST.description:
This field indicates the states of the I2C module state machine. 
0: Idle, 1: Address shift, 2: ACK address, 3: Rx data, 4: Tx data, 5: Send ACK, 6: Wait ACK

SCL_STATE_LAST.description:
This field indicates the states of the state machine used to produce SCL.
0: Idle, 1: Start, 2: Negative edge, 3: Low, 4: Positive edge, 5: High, 6: Stop

TIME_OUT_VALUE.description:
This register is used to configure the timeout for receiving a data bit in APB
clock cycles.

TIME_OUT_EN.description: This is the enable bit for time out control.

RXFIFO_RADDR.description: This is the offset address of the APB reading from rxfifo

RXFIFO_WADDR.description: This is the offset address of i2c module receiving data and writing to rxfifo.

TXFIFO_RADDR.description: This is the offset address of i2c module reading from txfifo.

TXFIFO_WADDR.description: This is the offset address of APB bus writing to txfifo.

RXFIFO_WM_THRHD.description: The water mark threshold of rx FIFO in nonfifo access mode. When reg_reg_fifo_prt_en is 1 and rx FIFO counter is bigger than reg_rxfifo_wm_thrhd[3:0], reg_rxfifo_wm_int_raw bit will be valid.

TXFIFO_WM_THRHD.description: The water mark threshold of tx FIFO in nonfifo access mode. When reg_reg_fifo_prt_en is 1 and tx FIFO counter is smaller than reg_txfifo_wm_thrhd[3:0], reg_txfifo_wm_int_raw bit will be valid.

NONFIFO_EN.description: Set this bit to enable APB nonfifo access.

RX_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset rx-fifo.

TX_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset tx-fifo.

FIFO_PRT_EN.description: The control enable bit of FIFO pointer in non-fifo access mode. This bit controls the valid bits and the interrupts of tx/rx_fifo overflow, underflow, full and empty.

FIFO_RDATA.description: The value of rx FIFO read data.

RXFIFO_WM_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_RXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_WM_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_TXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

TIME.description:
This register is used to configure the time to hold the data after the negative
edge of SCL, in I2C module clock cycles.
This register is used to configure for how long SDA is sampled, in I2C module clock cycles.

SCL_HIGH_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure for how long SCL setup to high level and remains high in master mode, in I2C module clock cycles.

SCL_WAIT_HIGH_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure for the SCL_FSM's waiting period for SCL high level in master mode, in I2C module clock cycles.

TIME.description:
This register is used to configure the time between the negative edge
of SDA and the negative edge of SCL for a START condition, in I2C module clock cycles.

This register is used to configure the time between the positive
edge of SCL and the negative edge of SDA for a RESTART condition, in I2C module clock cycles.

This register is used to configure the delay after the STOP condition,
in I2C module clock cycles.

This register is used to configure the time between the positive edge
of SCL and the positive edge of SDA, in I2C module clock cycles.

SCL_FILTER_THRES.description:
When a pulse on the SCL input has smaller width than this register value
in I2C module clock cycles, the I2C controller will ignore that pulse.

SDA_FILTER_THRES.description:
When a pulse on the SDA input has smaller width than this register value
in I2C module clock cycles, the I2C controller will ignore that pulse.

SCL_FILTER_EN.description: This is the filter enable bit for SCL.

SDA_FILTER_EN.description: This is the filter enable bit for SDA.

SCLK_DIV_NUM.description: the integral part of the fractional divisor for i2c module

SCLK_DIV_A.description: the numerator of the fractional part of the fractional divisor for i2c module

SCLK_DIV_B.description: the denominator of the fractional part of the fractional divisor for i2c module

SCLK_SEL.description: The clock selection for i2c module:0-XTAL,1-CLK_8MHz.

SCLK_ACTIVE.description: The clock switch for i2c module

COMMAND.description:
This is the content of command 0. It consists of three parts: 
op_code is the command, 0: RSTART, 1: WRITE, 2: READ, 3: STOP, 4: END.
Byte_num represents the number of bytes that need to be sent or received.
ack_check_en, ack_exp and ack are used to control the ACK bit. See I2C cmd structure for more
Information.

COMMAND_DONE.description:
When command 0 is done in I2C Master mode, this bit changes to high
level.

SCL_ST_TO_I2C.description: The threshold value of SCL_FSM state unchanged period. It should be o more than 23

SCL_MAIN_ST_TO_I2C.description: The threshold value of SCL_MAIN_FSM state unchanged period.nIt should be o more than 23

SCL_RST_SLV_EN.description: When I2C master is IDLE, set this bit to send out SCL pulses. The number of pulses equals to reg_scl_rst_slv_num[4:0].

SCL_RST_SLV_NUM.description: Configure the pulses of SCL generated in I2C master mode. Valid when reg_scl_rst_slv_en is 1.

SCL_PD_EN.description: The power down enable bit for the I2C output SCL line. 1: Power down. 0: Not power down. Set reg_scl_force_out and reg_scl_pd_en to 1 to stretch SCL low.

SDA_PD_EN.description: The power down enable bit for the I2C output SDA line. 1: Power down. 0: Not power down. Set reg_sda_force_out and reg_sda_pd_en to 1 to stretch SDA low.

DATE.description: This is the the version register.

TXFIFO_START_ADDR.description: This is the I2C txfifo first address.

RXFIFO_START_ADDR.description: This is the I2C rxfifo first address.

GPIO%s.description: IO MUX Configure Register for pad XTAL_32K_P

CLK_OUT1.description: If you want to output clock for I2S to CLK_OUT_out1, set this register to 0x0. CLK_OUT_out1 can be found in peripheral output signals.

CLK_OUT2.description: If you want to output clock for I2S to CLK_OUT_out2, set this register to 0x0. CLK_OUT_out2 can be found in peripheral output signals.

CLK_OUT3.description: If you want to output clock for I2S to CLK_OUT_out3, set this register to 0x0. CLK_OUT_out3 can be found in peripheral output signals.

MCU_OE.description: Output enable of the pad in sleep mode. 1: output enabled; 0: output disabled.

SLP_SEL.description: Sleep mode selection of this pad. Set to 1 to put the pad in pad mode.

MCU_WPD.description: Pull-down enable of the pad in sleep mode. 1: internal pull-down enabled; 0: internal pull-down disabled.

MCU_WPU.description: Pull-up enable of the pad during sleep mode. 1: internal pull-up enabled; 0: internal pull-up disabled.

MCU_IE.description: Input enable of the pad during sleep mode. 1: input enabled; 0: input disabled.

FUN_WPD.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled; 0: internal pull-down disabled.

FUN_WPU.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled; 0: internal pull-up disabled.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable of the pad. 1: input enabled; 0: input disabled.

FUN_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA; 1: ~10mA; 2: ~20mA; 3: ~40mA.

MCU_SEL.description: Select IO MUX function for this signal. 0: Select Function 1; 1: Select Function 2; etc.

FILTER_EN.description: Enable filter for pin input signals. 1: Filter enabled; 2: Filter disabled.

TIMER_SEL.description:
This field is used to select one of timers for channel %s.

0: select timer0; 1: select timer1; 2: select timer2; 3: select timer3

SIG_OUT_EN.description: Set this bit to enable signal output on channel %s.

IDLE_LV.description: This bit is used to control the output value when channel %s is inactive (when LEDC_SIG_OUT_EN_CH%s is 0).

PARA_UP.description: This bit is used to update LEDC_HPOINT_CH%s, LEDC_DUTY_START_CH%s, LEDC_SIG_OUT_EN_CH%s, LEDC_TIMER_SEL_CH%s, LEDC_DUTY_NUM_CH%s, LEDC_DUTY_CYCLE_CH%s, LEDC_DUTY_SCALE_CH%s, LEDC_DUTY_INC_CH%s, and LEDC_OVF_CNT_EN_CH%s fields for channel %s, and will be automatically cleared by hardware.

OVF_NUM.description:
This register is used to configure the maximum times of overflow minus 1.

The LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH%s_INT interrupt will be triggered when channel %s overflows for (LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH%s + 1) times.

OVF_CNT_EN.description: This bit is used to enable the ovf_cnt of channel %s.

OVF_CNT_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset the ovf_cnt of channel %s.

HPOINT.description: The output value changes to high when the selected timers has reached the value specified by this register.

DUTY.description:
This register is used to change the output duty by controlling the Lpoint.

The output value turns to low when the selected timers has reached the Lpoint.

DUTY_SCALE.description: This register is used to configure the changing step scale of duty on channel %s.

DUTY_CYCLE.description: The duty will change every LEDC_DUTY_CYCLE_CH%s on channel %s.

DUTY_NUM.description: This register is used to control the number of times the duty cycle will be changed.

DUTY_INC.description: This register is used to increase or decrease the duty of output signal on channel %s. 1: Increase; 0: Decrease.

DUTY_START.description: Other configured fields in LEDC_CH%s_CONF1_REG will start to take effect when this bit is set to 1.

DUTY_CH0_R.description: This register stores the current duty of output signal on channel %s.

DUTY_RES.description: This register is used to control the range of the counter in timer %s.

CLK_DIV.description:
This register is used to configure the divisor for the divider in timer %s.

The least significant eight bits represent the fractional part.

PAUSE.description: This bit is used to suspend the counter in timer %s.

RST.description: This bit is used to reset timer %s. The counter will show 0 after reset.

TICK_SEL.description:
This bit is used to select clock for timer %s. When this bit is set to 1 LEDC_APB_CLK_SEL[1:0] should be 1, otherwise the timer clock may be not accurate.

1'h0: SLOW_CLK 1'h1: REF_TICK

PARA_UP.description: Set this bit to update LEDC_CLK_DIV_TIMER%s and LEDC_TIMER%s_DUTY_RES.

CNT.description: This register stores the current counter value of timer %s.

OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer0 has reached its maximum counter value.

TIMER1_OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer1 has reached its maximum counter value.

TIMER2_OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer2 has reached its maximum counter value.

TIMER3_OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer3 has reached its maximum counter value.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH0_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 0. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH1_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 1. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH2_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 2. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 3. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 4. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 5. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

OVF_CNT_CH0_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 0. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH0.

OVF_CNT_CH1_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 1. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH1.

OVF_CNT_CH2_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 2. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH2.

OVF_CNT_CH3_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 3. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH3.

OVF_CNT_CH4_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 4. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH4.

OVF_CNT_CH5_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 5. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH5.

OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_TIMER0_OVF_INT interrupt when LEDC_TIMER0_OVF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TIMER1_OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_TIMER1_OVF_INT interrupt when LEDC_TIMER1_OVF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TIMER2_OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_TIMER2_OVF_INT interrupt when LEDC_TIMER2_OVF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TIMER3_OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_TIMER3_OVF_INT interrupt when LEDC_TIMER3_OVF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH0_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH0_INT interrupt when LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH0_INT_ENAIS set to 1.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH1_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH1_INT interrupt when LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH1_INT_ENAIS set to 1.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH2_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH2_INT interrupt when LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH2_INT_ENAIS set to 1.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT interrupt when LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT_ENAIS set to 1.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT interrupt when LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT_ENAIS set to 1.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT interrupt when LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT_ENAIS set to 1.

OVF_CNT_CH0_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH0_INT interrupt when LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH0_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OVF_CNT_CH1_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH1_INT interrupt when LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH1_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OVF_CNT_CH2_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH2_INT interrupt when LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH2_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OVF_CNT_CH3_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH3_INT interrupt when LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH3_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OVF_CNT_CH4_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH4_INT interrupt when LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH4_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OVF_CNT_CH5_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt status bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH5_INT interrupt when LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH5_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OVF_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_TIMER0_OVF_INT interrupt.

TIMER1_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_TIMER1_OVF_INT interrupt.

TIMER2_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_TIMER2_OVF_INT interrupt.

TIMER3_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_TIMER3_OVF_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT interrupt.

OVF_CNT_CH0_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH0_INT interrupt.

OVF_CNT_CH1_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit for the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH1_INT interrupt.

TIMER1_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_TIMER1_OVF_INT interrupt.

TIMER2_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_TIMER2_OVF_INT interrupt.

TIMER3_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_TIMER3_OVF_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH0_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH0_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH1_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH1_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH2_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH2_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH3_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH4_INT interrupt.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_DUTY_CHNG_END_CH5_INT interrupt.

OVF_CNT_CH1_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH1_INT interrupt.

APB_CLK_SEL.description:
This bit is used to select clock source for the 4 timers .

2'd1: APB_CLK 2'd2: RTC8M_CLK 2'd3: XTAL_CLK

CLK_EN.description:
This bit is used to control clock.

1'b1: Force clock on for register. 1'h0: Support clock only when application writes registers.

LEDC_DATE.description: This is the version control register.

XTL_EN_WAIT.description: wait bias_sleep and current source wakeup

DG_WRAP_FORCE_RST.description: digital wrap force reset in deep sleep

DG_WRAP_FORCE_NORST.description: digital core force no reset in deep sleep

TIMER_SYS_STALL.description: Enable to record system stall time

TIMER_XTL_OFF.description: Enable to record 40M XTAL OFF time

TIMER_SYS_RST.description: enable to record system reset time

TIME_UPDATE.description: Set 1: to update register with RTC timer

SW_CPU_INT.description: rtc software interrupt to main cpu

CPU_STALL_WAIT.description: CPU stall wait cycles in fast_clk_rtc

MIN_TIME_CK8M_OFF.description: minimal cycles in slow_clk_rtc for CK8M in power down state

MAIN_TIMER_INT_CLR.description: Clear RTC main timer interrupt state

SWD_INT_CLR.description: Clear super watch dog interrupt state

XTL_EXT_CTR_LV.description: 0: power down XTAL at high level

GPIO_WAKEUP_FILTER.description: enable filter for gpio wakeup event

CK8M_DIV_SEL_VLD.description: used to sync reg_ck8m_div_sel bus. Clear vld before set reg_ck8m_div_sel

DIG_XTAL32K_EN.description: enable CK_XTAL_32K for digital core (no relationship with RTC core)

DIG_CLK8M_D256_EN.description: enable CK8M_D256_OUT for digital core (no relationship with RTC core)

DIG_CLK8M_EN.description: enable CK8M for digital core (no relationship with RTC core)

XTAL_FORCE_NOGATING.description: XTAL force no gating during sleep

CK8M_FORCE_NOGATING.description: CK8M force no gating during sleep

ANA_CLK_DIV_VLD.description: used to sync div bus. clear vld before set reg_rtc_ana_clk_div

PD_CUR_DEEP_SLP.description: xpd cur when rtc in sleep_state

PD_CUR_MONITOR.description: xpd cur when rtc in monitor state

BIAS_SLEEP_MONITOR.description: bias_sleep when rtc in monitor state

DBG_ATTEN_DEEP_SLP.description: DBG_ATTEN when rtc in sleep state

DBG_ATTEN_MONITOR.description: DBG_ATTEN when rtc in active state

REGULATOR_FORCE_PD.description: RTC_REG force power down (for RTC_REG power down means decrease the voltage to 0.8v or lower )

LSLP_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: memories in digital core force PD in sleep

LSLP_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: memories in digital core force no PD in sleep

DG_PAD_AUTOHOLD.description: read only register to indicate digital pad auto-hold status

CLR_DG_PAD_AUTOHOLD.description: wtite only register to clear digital pad auto-hold

SWD_SIGNAL_WIDTH.description: adjust signal width send to swd

SWD_AUTO_FEED_EN.description: automatically feed swd when int comes

TOUCH_STATE_SWITCH.description: touch is about to working. Switch rtc main state

COCPU_STATE_SWITCH.description: ulp/cocpu is about to working. Switch rtc main state

MAIN_STATE_PLL_ON.description: rtc main state machine is in states that pll should be running

RDY_FOR_WAKEUP.description: rtc is ready to receive wake up trigger from wake up source

MAIN_STATE_WAIT_END.description: rtc main state machine has been waited for some cycles

IN_WAKEUP_STATE.description: rtc main state machine is in the states of wakeup process

IN_LOW_POWER_STATE.description: rtc main state machine is in the states of low power

MAIN_STATE_IN_WAIT_8M.description: rtc main state machine is in wait 8m state

MAIN_STATE_IN_WAIT_PLL.description: rtc main state machine is in wait pll state

MAIN_STATE_IN_WAIT_XTL.description: rtc main state machine is in wait xtal state

MAIN_STATE_IN_SLP.description: rtc main state machine is in sleep state

MAIN_STATE_IN_IDLE.description: rtc main state machine is in idle state

BROWN_OUT_CLOSE_FLASH_ENA.description: enable close flash when brown out happens

BROWN_OUT_PD_RF_ENA.description: enable power down RF when brown out happens

XTS_AES_KEY_UPDATE.description: Set this bit to update xts_aes key

H_MEM[%s].description: Sha H memory which contains intermediate hash or finial hash.

M_MEM[%s].description: Sha M memory which contains message.

T_STRING.description: Sha t_string (used if and only if mode == SHA_512/t).

T_LENGTH.description: Sha t_length (used if and only if mode == SHA_512/t).

INTERRUPT_ENA.description: Sha interrupt enable register. 1'b0: disable(default). 1'b1: enable.

DATE.description: Sha date information/ sha version information.

DIN_MODE.description: SPI0 input delay mode control register

DIN_NUM.description: SPI0 input delay number control register

DOUT_MODE.description: SPI0 output delay mode control register

FDUMMY_OUT.description: In the dummy phase the signal level of spi is output by the spi controller.

FCMD_DUAL.description: Apply 2 signals during command phase 1:enable 0: disable

FCMD_QUAD.description: Apply 4 signals during command phase 1:enable 0: disable

FASTRD_MODE.description: This bit enable the bits: SPI_MEM_FREAD_QIO, SPI_MEM_FREAD_DIO, SPI_MEM_FREAD_QOUT AND SPI_MEM_FREAD_DOUT. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_DUAL.description: In the read operations, read-data phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

Q_POL.description: The bit is used to set MISO line polarity, 1: high 0, low

D_POL.description: The bit is used to set MOSI line polarity, 1: high 0, low

FREAD_QUAD.description: In the read operations read-data phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

WP.description: Write protect signal output when SPI is idle.  1: output high, 0: output low.

FREAD_DIO.description: In the read operations address phase and read-data phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_QIO.description: In the read operations address phase and read-data phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

CLK_MODE.description: SPI clock mode bits. 0: SPI clock is off when CS inactive 1: SPI clock is delayed one cycle after CS inactive 2: SPI clock is delayed two cycles after CS inactive 3: SPI clock is alwasy on.

CS_SETUP_TIME.description: (cycles-1) of prepare phase by spi clock this bits are combined with spi_mem_cs_setup bit.

CS_HOLD_TIME.description: Spi cs signal is delayed to inactive by spi clock this bits are combined with spi_mem_cs_hold bit.

CS_HOLD_DELAY.description: These bits are used to set the minimum CS high time tSHSL between SPI burst transfer when accesses to flash. tSHSL is (SPI_MEM_CS_HOLD_DELAY[5:0] + 1) MSPI core clock cycles.

CLKCNT_L.description: In the master mode it must be equal to spi_mem_clkcnt_N.

CLKCNT_H.description: In the master mode it must be floor((spi_mem_clkcnt_N+1)/2-1).

CLKCNT_N.description: In the master mode it is the divider of spi_mem_clk. So spi_mem_clk frequency is system/(spi_mem_clkcnt_N+1)

CS_HOLD.description: spi cs keep low when spi is in  done  phase. 1: enable 0: disable.

CS_SETUP.description: spi cs is enable when spi is in  prepare  phase. 1: enable 0: disable.

CK_OUT_EDGE.description: the bit combined with spi_mem_mosi_delay_mode bits to set mosi signal delay mode.

USR_DUMMY_IDLE.description: spi clock is disable in dummy phase when the bit is enable.

USR_DUMMY.description: This bit enable the dummy phase of an operation.

USR_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: The length in spi_mem_clk cycles of dummy phase. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

USR_ADDR_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of address phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

USR_COMMAND_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of command phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1)

WB_MODE.description: Mode bits in the flash fast read mode  it is combined with spi_mem_fastrd_mode bit.

TRANS_END.description: The bit is used to indicate the  spi0_mst_st controlled transmitting is done.

TRANS_END_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt of  spi0_mst_st controlled transmitting is done.

CSPI_ST_TRANS_END.description: The bit is used to indicate the  spi0_slv_st controlled transmitting is done.

CSPI_ST_TRANS_END_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt of spi0_slv_st controlled transmitting is done.

CK_IDLE_EDGE.description: 1: spi clk line is high when idle     0: spi clk line is low when idle

CS_KEEP_ACTIVE.description: spi cs line keep low when the bit is set.

CACHE_REQ_EN.description: For SPI0, Cache access enable, 1: enable, 0:disable.

CACHE_USR_ADDR_4BYTE.description: For SPI0,  cache  read flash with 4 bytes address, 1: enable, 0:disable.

CACHE_FLASH_USR_CMD.description: For SPI0,  cache  read flash for user define command, 1: enable, 0:disable.

FDIN_DUAL.description: For SPI0 flash, din phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable. The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_dio.

FDOUT_DUAL.description: For SPI0 flash, dout phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable. The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_dio.

FADDR_DUAL.description: For SPI0 flash, address phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_dio.

FDIN_QUAD.description: For SPI0 flash, din phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_qio.

FDOUT_QUAD.description: For SPI0 flash, dout phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_qio.

FADDR_QUAD.description: For SPI0 flash, address phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_qio.

CSPI_ST.description: The current status of SPI0 slave FSM: spi0_slv_st. 0: idle state, 1: preparation state, 2: send command state, 3: send address state, 4: wait state, 5: read data state, 6:write data state, 7: done state, 8: read data end state.

EM_ST.description: The current status of SPI0 master FSM: spi0_mst_st. 0: idle state, 1:EM_CACHE_GRANT , 2: program/erase suspend state, 3: SPI0 read data state, 4: wait cache/EDMA sent data is stored in SPI0 TX FIFO, 5: SPI0 write data state.

CSPI_LOCK_DELAY_TIME.description: The lock delay time of SPI0/1 arbiter by spi0_slv_st, after PER is sent by SPI1.

TIMING_CLK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable timing adjust clock for all reading operations.

TIMING_CALI.description: The bit is used to enable timing auto-calibration for all reading operations.

EXTRA_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: add extra dummy spi clock cycle length for spi clock calibration.

DIN0_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN1_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN2_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN3_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN0_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DIN1_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DIN2_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DIN3_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DOUT0_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

DOUT1_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

DOUT2_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

DOUT3_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

CLK_EN.description: Register clock gate enable signal. 1: Enable. 0: Disable.

SPI01_CLK_SEL.description: When the digital system clock selects PLL clock and the frequency of PLL clock is 480MHz, the value of reg_spi01_clk_sel:  0: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 80MHz. 1: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 120MHz.  2: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) 160MHz. 3: Not used. When the digital system clock selects PLL clock and the frequency of PLL clock is 320MHz, the value of reg_spi01_clk_sel:  0: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 80MHz. 1: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 80MHz.  2: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) 160MHz. 3: Not used.

CLK_EN_ASSIST_DEBUG.description: Set 1 to open assist_debug module clock

CLK_EN_DEDICATED_GPIO.description: Set 1 to open dedicated_gpio module clk

RST_EN_ASSIST_DEBUG.description: Set 1 to let assist_debug module reset

RST_EN_DEDICATED_GPIO.description: Set 1 to let dedicated_gpio module reset

CPUPERIOD_SEL.description: This field used to sel cpu clock frequent.

PLL_FREQ_SEL.description: This field used to sel pll frequent.

CPU_WAITI_DELAY_NUM.description: This field used to set delay cycle when cpu enter waiti mode, after delay waiti_clk will close

LSLP_MEM_PD_MASK.description: Set 1 to mask memory power down.

BT_LPCK_DIV_NUM.description: This field is lower power clock frequent division factor

BT_LPCK_DIV_B.description: This field is lower power clock frequent division factor b

BT_LPCK_DIV_A.description: This field is lower power clock frequent division factor a

LPCLK_SEL_RTC_SLOW.description: Set 1 to select rtc-slow clock as rtc low power clock

LPCLK_SEL_8M.description: Set 1 to select 8m clock as rtc low power clock

LPCLK_SEL_XTAL.description: Set 1 to select xtal clock as rtc low power clock

LPCLK_SEL_XTAL32K.description: Set 1 to select xtal32k clock as low power clock

LPCLK_RTC_EN.description: Set 1 to enable RTC low power clock

RSA_MEM_PD.description: Set 1 to power down RSA memory. This bit has the lowest priority.When Digital Signature occupies the RSA. This bit is invalid.

RSA_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: Set 1 to force power up RSA memory. This bit has the second highest priority.

RSA_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: Set 1 to force power down RSA memory. This bit has the highest priority.

ENABLE_SPI_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.description: Set 1 to enable the SPI manual encrypt.

ENABLE_DOWNLOAD_DB_ENCRYPT.description: Set 1 to enable download DB encrypt.

ENABLE_DOWNLOAD_G0CB_DECRYPT.description: Set 1 to enable download G0CB decrypt

ENABLE_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.description: Set 1 to enable download manual encrypt

RTC_MEM_CRC_START.description: Set 1 to start the CRC of RTC memory

RTC_MEM_CRC_ADDR.description: This field is used to set address of RTC memory for CRC.

RTC_MEM_CRC_LEN.description: This field is used to set length of RTC memory for CRC based on start address.

RTC_MEM_CRC_FINISH.description: This bit stores the status of RTC memory CRC.1 means finished.

RTC_MEM_CRC_RES.description: This field stores the CRC result of RTC memory.

PRE_DIV_CNT.description: This field is used to set the count of prescaler of XTAL_CLK.

SOC_CLK_SEL.description: This field is used to select soc clock.

CLK_XTAL_FREQ.description: This field is used to read xtal frequency in MHz.

UNIT0_OP.description: system timer unit0 value update register

UNIT1_OP.description: system timer unit1 value update register

UNIT0_LOAD_HI.description: system timer unit0 value high load register

UNIT0_LOAD_LO.description: system timer unit0 value low load register

UNIT1_LOAD_LO.description: system timer unit1 value low load register

TARGET1_LO.description: system timer comp1 value low register

UNIT0_VALUE_LO.description: system timer unit0 value low register

UNIT1_VALUE_HI.description: system timer unit1 value high register

COMP1_LOAD.description: system timer comp1 conf sync register

UNIT0_LOAD.description: system timer unit0 conf sync register

UNIT1_LOAD.description: system timer unit1 conf sync register

TIMER_UNIT1_CORE0_STALL_EN.description: If timer unit1 is stalled when core0 stalled

TIMER_UNIT0_CORE1_STALL_EN.description: If timer unit0 is stalled when core1 stalled

TIMER_UNIT0_VALUE_VALID.description: timer value is sync and valid

TIMER_UNIT1_VALUE_VALID.description: timer value is sync and valid

LOWPULSE.description: Autobaud minimum low pulse duration register

HIGHPULSE.description: Autobaud minimum high pulse duration register

MEM_TX_STATUS.description: Tx-FIFO write and read offset address.

MEM_RX_STATUS.description: Rx-FIFO write and read offset address.

RXFIFO_RD_BYTE.description: UART 0 accesses FIFO via this register.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives more data than what rxfifo_full_thrhd specifies.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the amount of data in Tx-FIFO is less than what txfifo_empty_thrhd specifies .

PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a parity error in the data.

FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a data frame error .

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives more data than the FIFO can store.

DSR_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the edge change of DSRn signal.

CTS_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the edge change of CTSn signal.

BRK_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a 0 after the stop bit.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver takes more time than rx_tout_thrhd to receive a byte.

SW_XON_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver recevies Xon char when uart_sw_flow_con_en is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives Xoff char when uart_sw_flow_con_en is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a glitch in the middle of a start bit.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter completes  sending  NULL characters, after all data in Tx-FIFO are sent.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter has kept the shortest duration after sending the  last data.

TX_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter has send out all data in FIFO.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a parity error from the echo of transmitter in rs485 mode.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a data frame error from the echo of transmitter in rs485 mode.

RS485_CLASH_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when detects a clash between transmitter and receiver in rs485 mode.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the configured at_cmd char.

WAKEUP_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when input rxd edge changes more times than what reg_active_threshold specifies in light sleeping mode.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_full_int_raw when rxfifo_full_int_ena is set to 1.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for  txfifo_empty_int_raw  when txfifo_empty_int_ena is set to 1.

PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for parity_err_int_raw when parity_err_int_ena is set to 1.

FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for frm_err_int_raw when frm_err_int_ena is set to 1.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_ovf_int_raw when rxfifo_ovf_int_ena is set to 1.

DSR_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for dsr_chg_int_raw when dsr_chg_int_ena is set to 1.

CTS_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for cts_chg_int_raw when cts_chg_int_ena is set to 1.

BRK_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for brk_det_int_raw when brk_det_int_ena is set to 1.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_tout_int_raw when rxfifo_tout_int_ena is set to 1.

SW_XON_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for sw_xon_int_raw when sw_xon_int_ena is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for sw_xoff_int_raw when sw_xoff_int_ena is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for glitch_det_int_raw when glitch_det_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for tx_brk_done_int_raw when tx_brk_done_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the stauts bit for tx_brk_idle_done_int_raw when tx_brk_idle_done_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for tx_done_int_raw when tx_done_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_parity_err_int_raw when rs485_parity_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_frm_err_int_raw when rs485_fm_err_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_CLASH_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_clash_int_raw when rs485_clash_int_ena is set to 1.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for at_cmd_det_int_raw when at_cmd_char_det_int_ena is set to 1.

WAKEUP_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for uart_wakeup_int_raw when uart_wakeup_int_ena is set to 1.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for txfifo_empty_int_st register.

SW_XON_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for sw_xon_int_st register.

SW_XOFF_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for sw_xoff_int_st register.

GLITCH_DET_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for glitch_det_int_st register.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for tx_brk_done_int_st register.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for tx_brk_idle_done_int_st register.

TX_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for tx_done_int_st register.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rs485_parity_err_int_st register.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for rs485_parity_err_int_st register.

SW_XOFF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the sw_xoff_int_raw interrupt.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the rs485_parity_err_int_raw interrupt.
